title: Let's talk about Cloud (3)
body:
One of the interesting mechanics in Set 2 has been {{champion:246}} , who can change their element to match the map.  Usually, this has the possibility of profoundly impacting your build: 

1. Mountain gives you the ability to grab an early Mountain (2), where the large shield is more effective early game
2. Ocean unlocks the pursuit of Ocean (6), impossible to get otherwise
3. Inferno makes it much easier to get an assassin trio, and makes it so you only need two sunfires to get inferno (9)
4. Cloud (3) gives you +5% dodge??

What's up with that??  Even if you max out someone's dodge from items, the difference between 75% and 80% dodge isn't worth the hassle to get there.  All the other bonuses are strikingly better.  Why is it not +10% dodge at least?

replies.body: also Cloud Blade comp with qiyana is extremely weak against magic comp, especially now it's ocean mage meta. One level2 brand ult your entire team is dead
Ocean(6) is achievable regardless btw, because ocean lux avatar counts as 2.

>
> Ocean(6) is achievable regardless btw, because ocean lux avatar counts as 2.

Haha barely.  I don't really consider 1/10 of a tier 7 champ to be something you can plan a team around.

yea, i mean, it still offers similar options like mountain, giveing faster acces to cloud as you don't need a tier 4, and it opens up assasin/blade or assasin/mystik for the 2 cloud instead of hardlocking you into blade/mystik(though thx to yi that usually happens anyway)

But still, it'd be nice to have a 3 mountian bonus(maybw 2000-2500 shield up from then 1500 of 2 mountains), and could 3 could really get 5% more dodge(so 10 more than the 2coud) to make 3 cloud comps a bit more rewarding.
wait i thought cloud scales from 15% to 20% to 30% on tier 1, 2, 3

That's 2/3/4.  Form 2/3 you get practically nothing at all.

Looked it up by the way but Dodge chance is multiplicative. So if you have 80% dodge chance from 4 sources you actually have like 35% dodge chance, and cloud (3) would give a total of like 2% over cloud (2) I think.
